title: Textile, early 19th century
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: printed by engraved roller on plain weave
inscribed: by right selvedge, a medallion containing part of the monogram "P.W."
dimensions:
A. warp: 85 cm (33 1/2 in. ), weft(selvedge to selvedge) 72.5 (28 1/2 in.) B. warp: 44 cm (17 1/4 in. ), weft(selvedge to selvedge) 72.5 (28 1/2 in. )
Pattern: Height of repeat: 24 3/4 inches
description:
adaption of Nantes copper[;ate printed fabric called '1' agreable lecon' . 
some vignettes have been omitted; others added.
The title has been obliterated from the pillar and proportions have been changed.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, early 19th century.Medium: cotton
Technique: printed by engraved roller on plain weave. Gift of Harvey Smith. 1968-135-105.
